title: What is news worthy in the Keen community?
content:
If you had been absent from the forum for the last two weeks, what are the recent threads that you would want to have known about upon your return?

How would you want them presented; for example, would you prefer to see summaries of their content along with a link to the thread, or complete transcripts and some commentary? Is there anything else that could be done to improve their convenience?

Just curious. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: What is news worthy in the Keen community?
content:
Summaries, links. Just like the CK Newsletter.
(Is this an attempt to resurrect it?)------------------------------

title: Re: What is news worthy in the Keen community?
content:
I'd like to hear the news about the latest mods, and what's up with TUIT! Complete transcripts and some commentary for me rather than summaries.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: What is news worthy in the Keen community?
content: I've been gone for three weeks, so I really don't know what's gone on in my abscence.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: What is news worthy in the Keen community?
content:
If I wanted to keep tabs on a topic I would check the box at the bottom of this post that says:

"Email me notification of all replies to this topic."

Aaaand... that's all you need to do. Mods? Modding is something I find fun to do. Modding KEEN is something I was never interested in. So that's a mute point with me.

TUiT? The story has been the same yesterday, today and tomorrow. (For a few more years at least.)-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: What is news worthy in the Keen community?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]a mute point[hr][/quote]
Offtopic: Ah, FINALLY I get what people meant with "a moot point". Thanks. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: n00z
content:
Anyone care to name one or two specific threads you're most interested in at the moment? And in fact, a couple of examples of what you don't find exceptionally interesting would be useful too.

[hr]Gal If I wanted to keep tabs on a topic I would check the box at the bottom of this post that says:

"Email me notification of all replies to this topic."
[hr]You're still likely to miss out on some interesting stuff with that strategy. Off topic rants often bring about some classy stuff that is otherwise buried.

[hr]KeenRush I'd like to hear the news about the latest mods, and what's up with TUIT!
[hr]Yeah, mods go without saying. And if we heard anything about TUIT, or something directly from Tom Hall, that would be obvious news material.

What I'd like to know about are the less community-impacting topics. For example, curiosities like [url=http://p098.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumothercommanderkeenstuff.showMessage?topicID=1304.topic] Keen pictures I drew when I was a kid[/url] and unexpected reunions as occurred in [url=http://p098.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm17.showMessage?topicID=1190.topic]Isis II source code?[/url].

[hr]Shadow Master (Is this an attempt to resurrect it?)
[hr]Sort of. It's an idea I've had for a long time, after noticing the frequency of MSN conversations with Keeners who don't visit the PCKF regularly to ask what's been going on, and my difficulty in summarising the interesting stuff.

It's taken me a while to learn the necessary skills to make it happen. I just need an indication of what events and discussions really interest people.

title: hmm
content:
I'm most interested in topics about the generation of new material--be it the "My Keen Comic" thread, or the "Anyone interested in working with Apogee music?" thread... the threads that lead to new eye or ear candy spark my interest.

The ones that I never pay much attention to are the misc. polls about "Death metal or polka?" or "Christianity or a punch in the face?" etc. etc.

title: Re: hmm
content:
If I was the moderator, I'd CLOSE the Miscellanea Polls subforum, and rename Miscellaneous to Off-topic. Having polls set by anyone that is not moderator o admin just doesn't make sense for Miscellenous forums.------------------------------

title: ofija
content: i regularly go absent for 2 weeks, and it's hardly any problem for me to catch up!

title: Re: ofija
content:
I think any :

A. Official news from concerning Keen.

B. Important mods and fan games (so like if the mod is a complete game not just some one level thing or if it's something never done before in mods, like when Celick made the Keen 4 mod) .

C. Important happenings in the Keen community, related to Keen, like when Mort started the Keen comic or if someone releases a really big pack of remixed Keen music.
